note: Vary by country; Bishops have authority to suppress Holy Days or move them to Sundays.

0.title: The Solemnity of the Ascension
0.dateNote: Thursday of the sixth week of Easter, transferred to the following Sunday in some diocese

0.title: The Most Holy Body and Blood of Christ (Corpus Christi)
0.dateNote: Sunday after the Most Holy Trinity

1.title: The Solemnity of Mary, Mother of God
1.note: If it falls on a Saturday or on a Monday, the precept to attend Mass is abrogated.

3.title: Saint Joseph Husband of the Blessed Virgin Mary

8.title: The Solemnity of the Assumption of the Blessed Virgin Mary
8.note: If it falls on a Saturday or on a Monday, the precept to attend Mass is abrogated.

11.title: The Solemnity of All Saints
11.note: If it falls on a Saturday or on a Monday, the precept to attend Mass is abrogated.

12.title: The Solemnity of the Immaculate Conception
The Solemnity of the Nativity of Our Lord Jesus Christ
